item.title: Care Bears: Unlock the Magic announced for PS5, PS4, and Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/care-bears-unlock-the-magic-announced-for-ps5-ps4-and-switch

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out on March 27, 2025.

Publishers Maximum Entertainment and Arcadia Interactive, and developer Xaloc Studios have announced Care Bears: Unlock the Magic for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch. It will launch on March 27, 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via Maximum Entertainment:

About

Dive into a world of fun and adventure with the Care Bears in Care Bears: Unlock the Magic. Play as Cheer Bear as and his friends in a variety of arcade games!

Key Features

  • Meet the Beloved Bears – Play alongside Cheer Bear, Bedtime Bear, Tenderheart Bear and all the lovely bears from Care A-Lot!
  • Go on a Journey – Explore over 200 levels across a dozen unique minigames in the whimsical universe of Care Bears! Get Star Power to remove the Storm Clouds from the Silver Lining, meet the funny Whiffles and reach the end of the magical road for a lovely surprise.
  • Classic Arcade Fun – Enjoy a variety of themed mini-games inspired by classic arcade favorites: Care Bubbles, Cross The Rainbow, Lost Whiffle and many more!
  • Fill the Art Book – As you progress, earn unique stickers featuring art and bears from the Care Bears : Unlock the Magic television show. Collect them all!

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen: Cursed Clash adds Ultimate Mechamaru via free update and Mei Mei, Naobito Zen’in, and Choso via paid DLC on November 21
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/jujutsu-kaisen-cursed-clash-adds-ultimate-mechamaru-via-free-update-and-mei-mei-naobito-zenin-and-choso-via-paid-dlc-on-november-21

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Four new fighters join the fray.

Two-versus-two action game Jujutsu Kaisen: Cursed Clash will add new playable character Ultimate Mechamaru via a free update and new playable characters Mei Mei, Naobito Zen’in, and Choso via paid downloadable content on November 21, publisher Bandai Namco and developer Byking announced.

Get the details below.

Free Update #4

  • Additional Playable Character
    • Ultimate Mechamaru (four color variations)
  • Additional Enemies in Online Cooperative Mode
    • Ultimate Mechamaru
    • Mei Mei
    • Naobito Zen’in
    • Suguru Geto?
    • Instant Spirit Body of Distorted Killing
    • Dagon
    • Choso
    • Haruta Shigemo
    • Uraume
    • Mahoraga
  • Additional Stage
    • Subway Platform
    • Outside Shibuya Facility
    • Inside Shibuya Facility
    • Destroyed Shibuya
  • Additional Customization Items
    • Title
    • Nickname
    • Plate
    • Emblem

Paid Downloadable Content

  • Additional Playable Characters
    • Mei Mei (four color variations)
    • Naobito Zen’in (four color variations)
    • Choso (four color variations)
  • Additional Scenario
    • Shibuya Incident
  • Additional Outfits
    • Mei Mei: Table Tennis Uniform (four color variations)
    • Naobito Zen’in: Normal Clothes B (four color variations)
    • Yuji Itadori: Clothes B (four color variations)
    • Megumi Fushiguro: Clothes B (four color variations)
    • Nobara Kugisawi: Clothes B (four color variations)
    • Satoru Gojo: Clothes B (four color variations)
  • Additional Items
    • Title
    • Emblem
    • Nickname
    • Plate
    • Menu Customization (Shibuya Incident)

Jujutsu Kaisen: Cursed Clash is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

DLC “Shibuya Incident” and Free Update #4 Trailer
